017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Supplier;
027
028import org.apiguardian.api.API;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.LazyImpl;
031
032/**
033 *  An instance of an implementation of this interface holds a value that will
034 *  be initialised by a call to the supplier (provided with the method
035 *  {@link #use(Supplier)})
036 *  on a first call to
037 *  {@link #get()}.
038 *  The methods
039 *  {@link #getAsString()}
040 *  and
041 *  {@link #getAsString(Stringer)}
042 *  do call {@code get()} internally.<br>
043 *  <br>For special purposes, the method
044 *  {@link #of(Object)}
045 *  creates an already initialised instance of {@code Lazy}.<br>
046 *  <br>Use
047 *  {@link #isPresent()}
048 *  to avoid unnecessary initialisation.<br>
049 *  <br>As a lazy initialisation makes the value unpredictable, it is necessary
050 *  that the implementations of
051 *  {@link #equals(Object)}
052 *  and
053 *  {@link #hashCode()}
054 *  do force the initialisation.<br>
055 *  <br>{@link #toString()}
056 *  will not force the initialisation.<br>
057 *  <br>This interface is not feasible for the lazy initialisation of
058 *  connections to resources of any kind, as these will usually throw (checked)
059 *  exceptions when problems arise, and usually these should be handled on one
060 *  central location.
061 *
062 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
063 *  @version $Id: Lazy.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
064 *  @since 0.0.5
065 *
066 *  @UMLGraph.link
067 *
068 *  @param  <T> The type of the value for this instance of {@code Lazy}.
069 */
070@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Lazy.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
071@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
072public sealed interface Lazy<T>
073    permits org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.LazyImpl
074{
075        /*-----------*\
076    ====** Constants **========================================================
077        \*-----------*/
078    /**
079     *  An empty array of {@code Lazy} objects.
080     */
081    @SuppressWarnings( "rawtypes" )
082    public static final Lazy [] EMPTY_Lazy_ARRAY = new Lazy [0];
083
084        /*---------*\
085    ====** Methods **==========================================================
086        \*---------*/
087    /**
088     *  {@inheritDoc}
089     */
090    @Override
091    public boolean equals( final Object obj );
092
093    /**
094     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy}.
095     *
096     *  @return The value.
097     */
098    public T get();
099
100    /**
101     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy} as its String
102     *  representation.<br>
103     *  <br>Basically it will call the value's
104     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
105     *  method.
106     *
107     *  @return The value as String.
108     */
109    public default String getAsString() { return getAsString( Objects::toString ); }
110
111    /**
112     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy} as a String that is
113     *  generated by the provided
114     *  {@link Stringer}.
115     *
116     *  @note As the value is allowed to be {@code null}, it is necessary that
117     *      the provided instance of {@code Function} can handle {@code null}
118     *      as a valid argument.
119     *
120     *  @param  stringer    The function that creates the String from the
121     *      value.
122     *  @return The value as String.
123     */
124    public default String getAsString( final Stringer<? super T> stringer )
125    {
126        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( get() );
127
128        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
129        return retValue;
130    }   //  getAsString()
131
132    /**
133     *  {@inheritDoc}
134     */
135    @Override
136    public int hashCode();
137
138    /**
139     *  If this {@code Lazy} instance has been initialised already, the
140     *  provided
141     *  {@link Consumer}
142     *  will be executed; otherwise nothing happens.
143     *
144     *  @param  consumer    The consumer.
145     */
146    public default void ifPresent( final Consumer<? super T> consumer )
147    {
148        if( isPresent() ) requireNonNullArgument( consumer, "consumer" ).accept( get() );
149    }   //  ifPresent()
150
151    /**
152     *  Checks whether this {@code Lazy} instance has been initialised already.
153     *  But even it was initialised,
154     *  {@link #get()}
155     *  may still return {@code null}.
156     *
157     *  @return {@code true} if the instance was initialised, {@code false}
158     *      otherwise.
159     */
160    public boolean isPresent();
161
162    /**
163     *  If this instance of {@code Lazy} is initialised, the provided mapper
164     *  function will be executed on the value.
165     *
166     *  @param  <R> The result type for the mapper function.
167     *  @param  mapper  The mapper function.
168     *  @return An instance of
169     *      {@link Optional}
170     *      that holds the result for the mapping.
171     */
172    public default <R> Optional<R> map( final Function<? super T,? extends R> mapper )
173    {
174        final Optional<R> retValue = isPresent() ? Optional.ofNullable( mapper.apply( get() ) ) : Optional.empty();
175
176        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
177        return retValue;
178    }   //  map()
179
180    /**
181     *  Creates a new {@code Lazy} instance that is already initialised.<br>
182     *  <br>This allows to use {@code Lazy} instances also for
183     *  {@linkplain java.lang.Cloneable cloneable}
184     *  objects, given that {@code T} is either cloneable itself or
185     *  immutable.
186     *
187     *  @param  <T> The type of the value for the new instance of {@code Lazy}.
188     *  @param  value   The value; can be {@code null}.
189     *  @return The new instance.
190     *
191     *  @see Object#clone()
192     */
193    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
194    public static <T> Lazy<T> of( final T value )
195    {
196        return new LazyImpl<>( value );
197    }   //  of()
198
199    /**
200     *  Returns the value or throws the exception that is created by the
201     *  given
202     *  {@link Supplier}
203     *  when not yet initialised.
204     *
205     *  @param  <X> The type of the implementation of
206     *      {@link Throwable}.
207     *  @param  exceptionSupplier   The supplier for the exception to throw
208     *      when the instance was not yet initialised.
209     *  @return The value.
210     *  @throws X   When not initialised, the exception created by the given
211     *      supplier will be thrown.
212     */
213    public <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow( Supplier<? extends X> exceptionSupplier ) throws X;
214
215    /**
216     *  {@inheritDoc}
217     */
218    @Override
219    public String toString();
220
221    /**
222     *  Creates a new {@code Lazy} instance that uses the given supplier to
223     *  initialise.
224     *
225     *  @param  <T> The type of the value for the new instance of {@code Lazy}.
226     *  @param  supplier    The supplier that initialises the value for this
227     *      instance on the first call to
228     *      {@link #get()}.
229     *  @return The new instance.
230     */
231    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
232    public static <T> Lazy<T> use( final Supplier<T> supplier )
233    {
234        return new LazyImpl<>( supplier );
235    }   //  use()
236}
237//  interface Lazy
238
239/*
240 *  End of File
241 */
